name: Warp
description: Warp™ is a strategic stealth-action puzzler where gamers play as Zero, a loveable yet lethal, little orange alien with a big score to settle. Abducted by a villainous General from his home world and taken to an underwater research facility, Zero must plan his ultimate escape by relying on his arsenal of special abilities.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP3, Windows Vista SP2, Windows 7 SP1Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo 2.0GHz or greater;AMD Athlon 64 X2 2.0GHz or greaterMemory: 2048MB or greaterHard Disk Space: 1.9GBVideo Card: ATI Radeon HD 3650 256MB card and the NVIDIA GeForce 8600 GT 256MB or equivalent.Video Card Note: NVIDIA GeForce 8400, 8500, 9400, and 210; ATI Radeon HD3450, HD4350,HD5450 and HD6450; Intel GMA X4500HD and HD Graphics 3000 are all below minimum system requirements.Sound: 100% DirectX9.0c compatible sound card and driversDirectX®: DirectX June 2010

reviews.review_text: And why do I not recommend this game. EA's Origin! Never even got the game running, 20 minutes of painfull Origin create profil, login, enter game serial. Run game, login again, enter game serial once more, game crashes, start game again, login yet another time, game crashes, reboot windows, run game, login just for the sake of login in, game crash, uninstall!  Steam, would you please ban EA Origin games!
its a very unique and fun puzzle game has a strong Portal 2 feel as i was playing it it felt like Mr. Peanut Vs. Apature Science... i will be doing at least 1 more playthrew of the game
good game but requires thought and patience while playing
This game is intresting with the mechanics and storyline and also after u get all the abilities u will need to discover some of them secrets which is awesome
Love the concept and it's kind of fun, but. ♥♥♥♥♥♥ frames, weird controls and Origin... I don't mind Origin i use it from time to time, But i much prefer steam, that's why i bought the game on steam.
I wish there was a way to NOT RECOMMEND games. REQUIRES ORIGIN! :(   Edit 11/26/2013 - Steam finally gave a way to not recommend games. Thank you!
Bad port of an average game. Should have stayed on console.
This is the greatest alien of All Time.

I just don't get why people complan about the whole EA thing. It doesn't border me AT ALL. Fun game, really addicted playing with a controller, and nice maps. I like the frag ability, especially when you make a scientist explode

This review is coming from somebody who only has a mouse and keyboard (basically just keyboard for this game) and beat the entire game.  The concept of the game is decent enough to keep you playing, the legnth is roughly 6 hours and the difficulty curve is simple enough to grasp at all points in the game. There are some MAJOR MAJOR flaws with this game though, however, its not enough to give it a 4/10, I would rate this game a 6.5 making it a game that I enjoyed moderately.   The problem with this game lies in its final stages, clunky control and hit and miss gameplay, literally.   Final stages: The last boss will send you to anger management. It is the most uninspired fight i have ever seen and is reminiscent of a bad crash bandicoot boss fight. The final stages are also painful to play for a keyboard gamer (controller players seem to be ok) seeing as you need to be very precise with your aiming and control of the character.  Clunky control: If you preform the same action twice the results may not be the same. If you line your character up with a specific warp or you choose to throw an item the item may just wind up doing different things due to the physics engine; now don't get me wrong, in some games this may be good, however, in this game it is unforgiving and frustrating at times.  I still recommend this game simply because throughout all of my rage, and at times fun gameplay i still finished it, despite origin and whatnot. The game never crashed and never loaded slowly (and I loaded A LOT, TRUST ME.)   TL;DR: 6.5/10 Not great, not bad, precisely average. Pick it up if its ever on sale, 10 is a wee bit over what I would think this should cost.

Once you get past all of the EA crap, This is an original, highly entertaining game. I've only just started to scratch the surface and I'm really impressed with the mechanics. The teleporting system is cool and it's really great that you can choose whether or not to be a giant ♥♥♥♥♥♥. The EA Login is a massive pain in the ♥♥♥, but it's a one off thing and doesn't really matter. You can literally just put in a fake account, that's how little it affects everything else. All in all, a great game. 8/10
Bloop! This game is adorable. Dunno why it didn't get more attention. The PC port isn't super great, but it works okay. Show it to your kids! They'll love it. Fun/5

Warp is a great game if you like the combo of cute but deadly, you play as an alien who was captured by scientists who want to find out what makes you tick, you soon escape and find that you are not the only one, it is a pretty gory game, but an excellent one. It has a lot of challenges and pure genius moments that will make you smile when you complete them, very fun to play and easy to get into. My only complaint is the length of main story, but it does have challenge rooms that should keep you busy.

This is a fun little game, and the bonus of getting it on sale makes it worth having. Really adorable concept, if the idea of blowing up bad guys from the inside can be referred to as 'adorable'. I'd pick it up, you can't beat 7-10hrs of entertainment for $2.50 (especially when a movie costs like $8).

EA sucks! They make you sign in to Origin, twice! Then they make you 'activate' the game with a CD key, twice! The menu sustem is also crap. It's inconsistent and clumsy. Please EA, just die already.  That said, the game is pretty awesome. I had a hard time putting it down and played for 3 hours in the first sitting. Graphics are good and control is decent, at least with a controller. I love all the little sounds the alien makes. If you're a fan on minions, you'll love this little guy.

yeah its from EA but its a very polished game well executed but bad ported to pc, u will need a game pad and the game needs some steam achiv..its charming and disturbing, its a good indie game. u should give it a try :)
